ICS 1C
Networked Information Discovery and Retrieval

ICS 1C Homework Assignment 3

Name: An Y. Lin
E-mail: easu246@ea.oac.uci.edu
Major: Economics
Minor: Management

Three neat Web finds:

  1. Movie Reviews
    Definitely my personal favorite. I love to watch movies during weekends. This will be a great way to find out what's good and what's not.
  2. The Woodstock Home Page
    Unbelievable!! Even cartoons have a place on the Net. It's wonderful since little children will find navigating on the Net interesting and relevant to them. This can be a great educational tool.
  3. The National University of Singapore
    This is absolutely amazing. Even though I knew I am within reach of the entire world on the Net, I could not believe it is this easy. This discovery is especially exciting for me since I grew up in Singapore and almost went to its National University for college.

    Questions I can now answer
    • What makes the Web so popular?
    • What are Web clients and servers, and how do they negotiate data format?
    • "The X-files"--How popular is this T.V. show?
    • How does one construct a sentence in Spanish?
    • What's new in business today?

    • What makes the Web so popular?

       The Web, unlike its predecessors, is extremely easy to use. Users do not have to master certain advanced technology to use the Web. In this day and age, it is extremely important for communication and information transfer to be as efficient and as cheap as possible. Vannevar Bush's As We May Think describes the importance of highly-accessible information and communication. The World Wide Web provides exactly this easy access. It is officially defined as a "wide-area hypermedia information retrieval initiative aiming to give universal access to a large universe of documents."

      Return to list of questions.

    • What are Web clients and servers, and how do they negotiate data format?

       The client is what a user uses to access the Web. It requests and obtains information from the server. The server in turn searches for the information and delivers the answer of the request from the file that it serves back to the client. The documents or resources are written in Hypertext Markup Language (HTML). The client tells the server what data formats it can handle, and the server delivers the document in the appropriate format. The file name of the document helps the server to identify which format is being used.

      Return to list of questions.

    • "The X-files"--How popular is this T.V. show?

      I HAD no clue. I have seen previews of each episode on television, but they look so bizarre and terrifying I did not have the nerve to watch any. But when I found the X-Files Home Page, with its full image and sound offerings, I was stunned. I thought someone must be really serious about this show. I looked through the web and discovered some very interesting information, including Pictures of the Cast, Viewer Survey, and an X-Files Episode Guide. I guess it should be safe to say that the "X-files" is a very popular show.

      Return to list of questions.

    • How does one construct a sentence in Spanish?

      First, you need to know the Spanish vocabulary for the words you want to use in your sentence. For beginners, you can use the small English-Spanish Dictionary. If you already know the simple words, you might want to purchase a good dictionary from the UCI Bookstore. Next, you need to learn the basic verbs, prepositions, adjectives, and other grammar usages. Spanish Lessons will give you a brief idea of how to put different words together using the correct grammar. Practice writing simple sentences. Ask your Spanish-speaking friends to help you.

      Return to list of questions.

    • What's new in business today?

       First, the Currency Exchange Rate is extremely important. It has tremendous direct as well as indirect impact on both domestic and international business. Second, politics, commerce and the society all have impacts on business, some in more ways than one. It is therefore important not only to know about a specific industry, but also of business news in general. If one is really serious about today's business, he or she could access the Harvard Business School Publishing Menu to find new, and better yet, analyzed, business information.
